description.narrative: By 2016, Federal, State and Municipal government and social actors of 50% of the municipalities of the States in the Semiarid and Amazon Regions, and large urban centres enrolled in the Urban Centre Platform, are using methodologies and tools to promote early childhood policies and are implementing an Integrated Policy for ECD prioritising actions aimed at accelerating the reduction of maternal and neonatal mortality and early pregnancy.

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)
Capacity development of ECD frontline workers
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
HSS - Health sector policy, planning and governance at national or sub-national levels
HSS - public finance management for Health
IMNCI / Integrated Community Case Management (iCCM) - Community
Multisector aid for basic social services
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Technical assistance - Maternal and newborn health

description.narrative: Development Partner affairs Technical staff services
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

title.narrative: UNICEF Programmes in Brazil (Citizen engagement and participation)
UNICEF Programmes in Brazil (Policies Monitoring and Cooperations)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Brazil 2018 Annual Report on Results for Children
Brazil 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Brazil 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, Federal, State and Municipal government and social actors of 50% of the municipalities of the States in the Semiarid and Amazon Regions, and large urban centres enrolled in the Urban Centre Platform, are using methodologies and tools to promote early childhood policies and are implementing an Integrated Policy for ECD prioritising actions aimed at accelerating the reduction of maternal and neonatal mortality and early pregnancy.

description.narrative: Despite the Zika virus epidemic emergency, UNICEF continued working with municipalities located in vulnerable areas through the UNICEF Seal Municipal Seal of Approval and in eight large urban centers, in order to fulfill the rights of women, families and children up to 6 years old. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:04/01/2017

title.narrative: % of municipalities enrolled in the UNICEF Seal and of large urban centers enrolled in the Urban Center Platform which have ECD Municipal Plans

target.value: 2016:40% of Seal municipalities, 50% of PCU municipalities

title.narrative: Existence of tools and methodologies to reduce early pregnancy (under 15)
% of municipalities enrolled in the UNICEF Seal and of large urban centers enrolled in the Urban Center Platform implementing the Baby Week Strategy

baseline.value: PAM: 32 (10% of municipalities enrolled) , SAB: 127 (12% of municipalities enrolled), Urban Centers: 2 (100% of municipalities enrolled in Urban Centers Platform)

title.narrative: % of States from the Amazon, the semiarid and where Urban Centers are located adopting methodologies and tools to improve municipal managers and social actor's competencies.

baseline.value: there is no systematic information available in the current edition of UNICEF Seal

title.narrative: Policy for home visits of new borns is developed and/or revised, adopted and in use

actual.value: 2016:Policy for home visits for new born adopted since 1990 (Community Health Agencies).
